text: Sanele Nohamba (born ) is a South African rugby union player for the in Super Rugby and the Currie Cup and the in the Rugby Challenge. His regular position is scrum-half. Nohamba represented South Africa Schools 'A' in 2016, South Africa Schools in 2017 and South Africa Under-20 at the 2019 World Rugby Under 20 Championship, where he scored 33 points through two tries, seven conversions and three penalties. He made his Currie Cup debut for the Sharks in July 2019, coming on as a replacement scrum-half in their opening match of the 2019 season against . ==References== ==External links== * Category:South African rugby union players Category:Living people Category:1999 births Category:People from Raymond Mhlaba Local Municipality Category:Rugby union scrum-halves Category:Sharks (Currie Cup) players Category:South Africa Under-20 international rugby union players
title: Sanele Nohamba
